text: {{Infobox settlement | name = Central Denmark Region | native_name = Region Midtjylland | native_name_lang = da | settlement_type = Region of Denmark | image_flag = Flag of Region Midtjylland.svg | image_blank_emblem = | blank_emblem_size = | blank_emblem_type = | image_map = Midtjylland in Denmark.svg | mapsize = | coordinates = | subdivision_type = Country | subdivision_name = Denmark | subdivision_type1 = Largest city | subdivision_name1 = Aarhus | seat_type = Capital | seat = Viborg | leader_title = Chairman | leader_name = | area_footnotes = | area_total_km2 = 13053 | population_footnotes = FOLK1: Population 1 October database from Statistics Denmark | population_total = 1313596 | population_as_of = January 2018 | population_density_km2 = auto | timezone1 = CET | utc_offset1 = +1 | timezone1_DST = CEST | utc_offset1_DST = +2 | website = www.rm.dk | footnotes = }} Central Denmark Region is an administrative region of Denmark. The capital city is Viborg. The city with the most people is Århus. ==Municipalities== * Favrskov * Hedensted * Herning * Holstebro * Horsens * Ikast-Brande * Lemvig * Norddjurs * Odder * Randers * Ringkøbing-Skjern * Samsø * Silkeborg * Skanderborg * Skive * Struer * Syddjurs * Viborg * Aarhus ==References== Category:2007 establishments in Denmark
title: Central Denmark Region
